publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-3853 David Whitton: Congratulations to Campsie Black Watch—That the Parliament congratulates the achievement of the Campsie Black Watch under-21 football team, based in Lennoxtown in East Dunbartonshire, on reaching its 13th Scottish Cup final; notes that, since being formed in 1943, Campsie Black Watch under-21s have won over 30 league titles and the Scottish Cup a record nine times, and also notes the dedication and hard work of the coaching staff, players and the manager, Gerry Marley, on taking his side to another Scottish Cup final. Supported by: Jackie Baillie*, Kenneth Gibson*, Hugh O’Donnell*, Stuart McMillan*, Jamie McGrigor*, Jamie Hepburn*, Mr Frank McAveety*, Elaine Murray*, Cathie Craigie*, Trish Godman*, Bill Kidd*, Mary Mulligan*
S3M-3853 Congratulations to Campsie Black Watch (lodged on 1 April 2009) Elaine Smith*, James Kelly*, John Park*, Des McNulty*, Hugh Henry*, Marilyn Livingstone*

S3M-3853 David Whitton: Congratulations to Campsie Black Watch—That the Parliament congratulates the achievement of the Campsie Black Watch under-21 football team, based in Lennoxtown in East Dunbartonshire, on reaching its 13th Scottish Cup final; notes that, since being formed in 1943, Campsie Black Watch under-21s have won over 30 league titles and the Scottish Cup a record nine times, and also notes the dedication and hard work of the coaching staff, players and the manager, Gerry Marley, on taking his side to another Scottish Cup final. Supported by: Jackie Baillie, Kenneth Gibson, Hugh O’Donnell, Stuart McMillan, Jamie McGrigor, Jamie Hepburn, Mr Frank McAveety, Elaine Murray, Cathie Craigie, Trish Godman, Bill Kidd, Mary Mulligan, Elaine Smith, James Kelly, John Park, Des McNulty, Hugh Henry, Marilyn Livingstone
S3M-3853 Congratulations to Campsie Black Watch (lodged on 1 April 2009) Karen Whitefield*
S3M-3853 Congratulations to Campsie Black Watch (lodged on 1 April 2009) Gil Paterson*
